chargeHist.descr: Possession with Intent to Distribute Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony A Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**49 days jail credit, if revoked** 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
AODA and follow through with recommendations- assessment to be completed within the first 6 months of Probation.

Defendant not to be involved in any traffic offenses involving controlled substances. 
Defendant not to consume, possess, or use any alcohol, illegal drugs, non-prescribed medications, or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant not to enter any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges or Electronic Monitoring services granted if available. 
All stayed pending further order of the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony A Butler

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 11:42 AM) Defendant Anthony A Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Anthony A Butler.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation with the following conditions: 180 days jail with Huber privileges or Electronic Monitoring services if available- all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations- assessment to be completed within the first 6 months of Probation; Defendant not to be involved in any traffic offenses involving controlled substances; Defendant not to consume, possess, or use any alcohol, illegal drugs, non-prescribed medications, or drug paraphernalia; Defendant not to enter any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where
alcohol is primarily served/sold; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders any contraband is destroyed. Court orders 49 days credit, if revoked.
Amending Count 1 to Possession with Intent to Deliver.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony A Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Anthony A Butler. 
Not guilty plea entered and received by the Court. 20 days to file motions which can be extended for good cause.
Br. 2 for scheduling STC.

9:55 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony A Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Anthony A Butler. 
Defendant had advised his attorney he would like to represent himself. Court has a colloquy with defendant regarding the decision. Court denies the request to have Attorney Schmidt to withdraw.
Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 1:34 PM.
Defendant Anthony A Butler in court, in custody with Attorney Karl A Schmidt.   Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Officer Sam Sperry of the ECPD. He is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Defense.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Branch 2 to schedule ARGN.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:03 case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony A Butler appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt. 
State requests a $10,000 cash bond with argument- $5000 cash bond ordered. 
A preliminary hearing is scheduled for 5-3-22 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with Regency Inn, M.M. or A.H.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level if released.
